commit_message:
Release Octavia RC2 for Antelope

This RC2 contains a workaround for a bug in openstacksdk [0].
As this bug may break octavia-dashboard in Antelope, we choose to apply
a workaround in Octavia.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstacksdk/+/876669

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 12.0.0.0rc1..4486d24
4486d241 Workaround an openstacksdk bug
d5013bf4 Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2023.1
b5267f74 Update .gitreview for stable/2023.1

Change-Id: I4bd59d4cfdb8a36252ddbf864154ec57f1175ea1

commit_message:
Enhancement of Tacker API resource access control

For fine-grained access control based on user and VNF information
for API resources, this patch does the following things:
1.Add three comparison attributes of area, vendor, and tenant
  for the enhanced Tacker policy.
2.Convert special roles to API attributes in context.
3.Modify the API process to support Tacker policy authorize.
4.Add the Tacker policy filter to the list API processes.

Implements: blueprint enhance-api-policy
Change-Id: I5b4c39387860133a3bcf4544f18a6353c80773f6

commit_message:
Avoid reconfiguring SR-IOV devices during stack update

The reconfiguration of an already configured SR-IOV device
in HW Offload mode trigger an unbind/bind operation leading to failures

Change-Id: I004ef317133e77bdfd971f1ac66e15d4e695cea7
(cherry picked from commit 23d97d35aff8571e78880237d88d0124768a7b2f)

subject: Pin tox to < 4.0.0
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2023-03-09 11:41:17.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'bindep.txt', 'src/wheelhouse.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Pin tox to < 4.0.0

Tox 4.0.0 was recently released and it has several breaking changes.
We pin to < 4.0.0 here. We are planning to move forward only on the
master charm branches.

Tox is also pinned to < 4.0.0 for stable branches in upstream
openstack-zuul-jobs as well as in zosci-config. However, the
requires= section in the charm's tox.ini file ends up installing
tox>4, wiping out the zuul-pinned tox<4 that was already installed
installed. This patch fixes that.

Additional changes include:
- Add bindep.txt changes from origin/master by hand.
- Switch charm-tools to 2.8.5 to remove ruamel requirement that
  doesn't work on Python 3.10.
- Pin zipp<=1.2.0, zipp >1.2.0. require setuptools>=42 (41.6.0 available atm)

Related-Bug: #2002788
Change-Id: If5e5beda90a918e8ff48f1d47fc91d90d79d27fe
Signed-off-by: Mustafa Kemal Gilor <mustafa.gilor@canonical.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Pin tox to < 4.0.0

Tox 4.0.0 was recently released and it has several breaking changes.
We pin to < 4.0.0 here. We are planning to move forward only on the
master charm branches.

Tox is also pinned to < 4.0.0 for stable branches in upstream
openstack-zuul-jobs as well as in zosci-config. However, the
requires= section in the charm's tox.ini file ends up installing
tox>4, wiping out the zuul-pinned tox<4 that was already installed
installed. This patch fixes that.

Additional changes include:
- Add bindep.txt changes from origin/master by hand.
- Switch charm-tools to 2.8.5 to remove ruamel requirement that
  doesn't work on Python 3.10.
- Pin zipp<=1.2.0, zipp >1.2.0. require setuptools>=42 (41.6.0 available atm)

Related-Bug: #2002788
Change-Id: If5e5beda90a918e8ff48f1d47fc91d90d79d27fe
Signed-off-by: Mustafa Kemal Gilor <mustafa.gilor@canonical.com>

subject: [heat-tempest-plugin] Tag ussuri-last & victoria-last
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2022-11-13 01:27:45.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/victoria/heat-tempest-plugin.yaml', 'deliverables/ussuri/heat-tempest-plugin.yaml'], 'message': '[heat-tempest-plugin] Tag ussuri-last & victoria-last

Ussuri and Victoria branches are in Extended Maintenance[1].
Once any stable branch is moved to EM state then, Tempest and
its plugins needs to be released[2] so that we have the compatible
tags to test the EM stable branches[3].

We taged ussuri-last & victoria-last for tempest[4] but forgot to do
it for the tempest plugins. Using the tag 1.5.0 hash which is compatible
for tempest ussuri-last and victoria-last.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/releases/+/843039

Change-Id: Ife104eaa4d75936e2514145153b1e70ca8ea054b
'}]
commit_message:
[heat-tempest-plugin] Tag ussuri-last & victoria-last

Ussuri and Victoria branches are in Extended Maintenance[1].
Once any stable branch is moved to EM state then, Tempest and
its plugins needs to be released[2] so that we have the compatible
tags to test the EM stable branches[3].

We taged ussuri-last & victoria-last for tempest[4] but forgot to do
it for the tempest plugins. Using the tag 1.5.0 hash which is compatible
for tempest ussuri-last and victoria-last.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/releases/+/843039

Change-Id: Ife104eaa4d75936e2514145153b1e70ca8ea054b

commit_message:
Release aodh for stable/xena

This release picks up new commits to aodh since
the last release from stable/xena.

This is being proposed as a convenience to help make sure stable
changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to
proceed.

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a stable release, please
leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can
then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new
commit hash to use instead.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 13.0.0..e6d55b1e
e6d55b1e gnocchi: Use Dynamic Aggregates API
231f404a Ignore Gnocchi API error when the metric is not yet created
71ce784c Bump minimum version of gnocchiclient for aggregats API support
8789bc59 [Xena] Remove TripleO job
5ac3421c Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena
eb8b0f19 Update .gitreview for stable/xena

Signed-off-by: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I6f75fdfa58b149c7e2e499865649cdb4ab0b229f

commit_message:
Fix for independent projects

Independent projects do not have "stable" branches, so the
new_release script will fail.
Set version to master and change it accordingly only if it's not
and independent project.

Change-Id: I9ba7f251d64e2bfca5c262acf9b20dc3da23fc87

commit_message:
Mock logging during unit tests

... to avoid huge number of IOError during tests. The BaseTestCase
class is un-deprecated because the class is still widely used and is
considered to be a good place to implement that common mocking.

Note this implementation is based on the one in cinder.

Story: 2009097
Task: 42939

Change-Id: I1a25a4575ba4c03ab66f8a8768b9e92c517088fa

commit_message:
Support multiple conductors onboarding

In current implementation,
onboarding process doesn't work when using Tacker as N-Act cluster.

This patch enables all conductors in the N-Act cluster
to download or delete VNF Package.

The functional test for multi-conductors environment will be added
in another patch.

Co-Authored-By: Hitomi Koba <hi-koba@kddi.com>
Co-Authored-By: Yukihiro Kinjo <yu-kinjou@kddi.com>
Co-Authored-By: Xu Hongjin <ho-xu@kddi.com>
Implements: blueprint support-multi-conductors-onboarding
Change-Id: Iabb100872d0d78bebc29378592dffba8e83710fc

* remove `file` scheme support for requests calls.

commit_message:
Fix wrong tcp port for heat-cfn endpoint with ssl

The heat-cfn api uses tcp/13005 for its public endpoint when ssl is
enabled. This corrects the wrong port in iptables rule.

Closes-Bug: #2003929
Change-Id: Ibb8037fad70c628ab26a6cf0dd4401bb6b23cc7c
(cherry picked from commit e98f23fd150886a2573dd5eb1f73677d62827433)

commit_message:
ovn-meta: Stop overriding metadata_workers

In 22.0.0 release (2023.1), default value of metadata_workers has been
changed to 0, which spawns the OVN metadata proxy handler in a local
thread rather than dedicated workers. This removes the hardcoding of
the option so that we can leverage the new default.

Related-Bug: #1993181
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/861649
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/861751
Change-Id: I599bcdeb8a81f8ea023283a0c0c156cf0182e72e

commit_message:
Fix access to configs hash symbol in get_auth_endpoint

The hash returned by the request method of Puppet::Provider::Openstack
uses symbols instead of strings as keys, see [1].

This prepends the missing ':' in front of the 'auth.auth_url' key to
make it a symbol and to have it return the actual value instead of
always coming back empty.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/src/commit/a1dfd6861f9593f005e72acaef7262e618d2cf6c/lib/puppet/provider/openstack.rb#L123

Closes-Bug: #2010894

Change-Id: I97546a1030559d1f91030a668106e220ce7a7650
(cherry picked from commit 5a6378c6dfc053f2e65867ae9b27537b4bc558a5)
(cherry picked from commit aab1d5b365d806d87bc9c82bb098d882d48d0e2d)

commit_message:
Support CNF auto scale via PM Threshold interface

Add the Performance Management Threshold API and CLI to support
AutoScale. The Performance Management Threshold API is based on
ETSI NFV-SOL 002 v3.3.1 and ETSI NFV-SOL 003 v3.3.1, on which v2
VNF LCM API of Tacker is based. Add the Prometheus Plugin that
has an interface between Tacker and Prometheus as a sample of
External Monitoring Tool.

Implements: blueprint support-auto-lcm
Change-Id: If41e89c5601592aea18a81df54d0db44a8588e1c

Similar to Ic43f561174ebf30474b1b54be2bed02695cebedc and
I83160aeec0a450f8678ecb583fb7570ac0e71f4a, this converts the existing
Review-Priority rules to submit-requirements following the gerrit
migration rules from [1].

These are all using "AnyWithBlock" which means that only the lowest
possible vote blocks submission.  Thus we replace this with a
submit-requirement of "-label:Review-Priority=MIN".  The function is
changed to NoBlock as done by the migration tool.

As with the prior change; the submit-requirement with the same name as
the label will avoid us having migrations run on these ACL's and
keep our gerrit in-sync with project-config.

Also as with the prior change, this should have no affect for users.

[1] https://gerrit-review.googlesource.com/c/gerrit/+/339542

Change-Id: Id5157b9f59082485b6aff92c4f3527fb4c8084aa
'}]
commit_message:
gerrit/acl : Convert Review-Priority to submit-requirements

Similar to Ic43f561174ebf30474b1b54be2bed02695cebedc and
I83160aeec0a450f8678ecb583fb7570ac0e71f4a, this converts the existing
Review-Priority rules to submit-requirements following the gerrit
migration rules from [1].

These are all using "AnyWithBlock" which means that only the lowest
possible vote blocks submission.  Thus we replace this with a
submit-requirement of "-label:Review-Priority=MIN".  The function is
changed to NoBlock as done by the migration tool.

As with the prior change; the submit-requirement with the same name as
the label will avoid us having migrations run on these ACL's and
keep our gerrit in-sync with project-config.

Also as with the prior change, this should have no affect for users.

[1] https://gerrit-review.googlesource.com/c/gerrit/+/339542

Change-Id: Id5157b9f59082485b6aff92c4f3527fb4c8084aa

subject: Correct share group tests cleanup order
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2023-03-06 18:58:38.000000000', 'files': ['manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/test_share_groups.py'], 'message': 'Correct share group tests cleanup order

Some share group tests were taking advantage of a bug in Manila.
Share network subnets were being allowed to be deleted even when
its share servers were tied to a share group. With that bug being
fixed, we need to ensure that the share groups are deleted before
the share network subnet alongside the share servers are.

Related-Bug: #2004212
Change-Id: I05607883c34bca586c795c7efab1df8d0edd6cff
'}]
commit_message:
Correct share group tests cleanup order

Some share group tests were taking advantage of a bug in Manila.
Share network subnets were being allowed to be deleted even when
its share servers were tied to a share group. With that bug being
fixed, we need to ensure that the share groups are deleted before
the share network subnet alongside the share servers are.

Related-Bug: #2004212
Change-Id: I05607883c34bca586c795c7efab1df8d0edd6cff

subject: Clean out agent token even if power is already off
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23851, 'name': 'Riccardo Pittau', 'email': 'elfosardo@gmail.com', 'username': 'elfosardo'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2023-03-02 15:02:23.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/unit/conductor/test_utils.py', 'ironic/conductor/utils.py', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-power-off-token-wipe-e7d605997f00d39d.yaml'], 'message': 'Clean out agent token even if power is already off

While investigating a very curious report, I discovered that
if somehow the power was *already* turned off to a node, say
through an incorrect BMC *or* human action, and Ironic were
to pick it up (as it does by default, because it checks before
applying the power state, then it would not wipe the token
information, preventing the agent from connecting on the next
action/attempt/operation.

We now remove the token on all calls to conductor
utilities node_power_action method when appropriate, even
if no other work is required.

Change-Id: Ie89e8be9ad2887467f277772445d4bef79fa5ea1
'}]
commit_message:
Clean out agent token even if power is already off

While investigating a very curious report, I discovered that
if somehow the power was *already* turned off to a node, say
through an incorrect BMC *or* human action, and Ironic were
to pick it up (as it does by default, because it checks before
applying the power state, then it would not wipe the token
information, preventing the agent from connecting on the next
action/attempt/operation.

We now remove the token on all calls to conductor
utilities node_power_action method when appropriate, even
if no other work is required.

Change-Id: Ie89e8be9ad2887467f277772445d4bef79fa5ea1

subject: gerrit/acl : handle key / values with multiple =
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2023-03-07 23:13:16.000000000', 'files': ['tools/normalize_acl.py'], 'message': 'gerrit/acl : handle key / values with multiple =

For things like submit-requirements, we have fields like submittableIf
which take a query string that may have "=" on the LHS.  Change the
key/value split so that it only takes the key up to the first "=".

Change-Id: Iada801bd1c38dd1e0502bebefd6a1421c746c90a
'}]
commit_message:
gerrit/acl : handle key / values with multiple =

For things like submit-requirements, we have fields like submittableIf
which take a query string that may have "=" on the LHS.  Change the
key/value split so that it only takes the key up to the first "=".

Change-Id: Iada801bd1c38dd1e0502bebefd6a1421c746c90a

commit_message:
Introduce a change that will allow more clients to make volumes

This change was written so that a new volume could be created by another client other than the primary admin.
This change also let this clients to attach/detach volumes.

Similar to Ic43f561174ebf30474b1b54be2bed02695cebedc, this converts
the existing Backport-Candidate rules to submit-requirements following
the gerrit migration rules from [1].

The function is left as NoBlock, and a no-op submit-requirement is
added with the same name.

As with the prior change; the submit-requirement with the same name as

commit_message:
gerrit/acl : Convert Backport-Candidate to submit-requirements

Similar to Ic43f561174ebf30474b1b54be2bed02695cebedc, this converts
the existing Backport-Candidate rules to submit-requirements following
the gerrit migration rules from [1].

The function is left as NoBlock, and a no-op submit-requirement is
added with the same name.

As with the prior change; the submit-requirement with the same name as
the label will avoid us having migrations run on these ACL's and keep
our gerrit in-sync with project-config.

Also as with the prior change, this should have no affect for users.

[1] https://gerrit-review.googlesource.com/c/gerrit/+/339542

Change-Id: I83160aeec0a450f8678ecb583fb7570ac0e71f4a

commit_message:
Allow unwinding nova DB manage cron jobs

Add enablement flags to classes managing Nova DB records purging and
archieving. With that change, cron jobs can be removed, if no longer
needed. For example, when the cron jobs were originally enabled but
later will be disabled so that users can always restore any deleted
instances.

Co-authored-by: Takashi Kajinami <tkajinam@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I4b2c65b91b83c7ac64f909359585aa76c19d4705
(cherry picked from commit 64cc577ceb191b4ed869f04019ee1791ce8b078f)

subject: Fix access to configs hash symbol in get_auth_endpoint
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-12 19:23:57.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/keystone.rb'], 'message': "Fix access to configs hash symbol in get_auth_endpoint

The hash returned by the request method of Puppet::Provider::Openstack
uses symbols instead of strings as keys, see [1].

This prepends the missing ':' in front of the 'auth.auth_url' key to
make it a symbol and to have it return the actual value instead of
always coming back empty.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/src/commit/a1dfd6861f9593f005e72acaef7262e618d2cf6c/lib/puppet/provider/openstack.rb#L123

Closes-Bug: #2010894

Change-Id: I97546a1030559d1f91030a668106e220ce7a7650
(cherry picked from commit 5a6378c6dfc053f2e65867ae9b27537b4bc558a5)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix access to configs hash symbol in get_auth_endpoint

The hash returned by the request method of Puppet::Provider::Openstack
uses symbols instead of strings as keys, see [1].

This prepends the missing ':' in front of the 'auth.auth_url' key to
make it a symbol and to have it return the actual value instead of
always coming back empty.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/src/commit/a1dfd6861f9593f005e72acaef7262e618d2cf6c/lib/puppet/provider/openstack.rb#L123

Closes-Bug: #2010894

Change-Id: I97546a1030559d1f91030a668106e220ce7a7650
(cherry picked from commit 5a6378c6dfc053f2e65867ae9b27537b4bc558a5)

subject: Neutron: Make sure overlay_ip_version is configured properly
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-03-13 13:42:03.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/neutron.pp'], 'message': "Neutron: Make sure overlay_ip_version is configured properly

Change 0797e82aca0a408838a49c1a269948e83d978b1c[1][2] fixed the ip
version used by ovs-agent but this effectively changed the ip version
used for underlying network. However that change did not update
the overlay_ip_version option accordingly and neutron records the error
caused by version mismatch continuously.

```
Invalid input for operation: ('Tunnel IP version does not match ML2
overlay_ip_version ...)
```

This change fixes that and ensures the option is set according to
the actual IP version.

Change-Id: Ied95886a30618ae2901cb2e9eacf9296a5911e8f
"}]
commit_message:
Neutron: Make sure overlay_ip_version is configured properly

Change 0797e82aca0a408838a49c1a269948e83d978b1c[1][2] fixed the ip
version used by ovs-agent but this effectively changed the ip version
used for underlying network. However that change did not update
the overlay_ip_version option accordingly and neutron records the error
caused by version mismatch continuously.

```
Invalid input for operation: ('Tunnel IP version does not match ML2
overlay_ip_version ...)
```

This change fixes that and ensures the option is set according to
the actual IP version.

Change-Id: Ied95886a30618ae2901cb2e9eacf9296a5911e8f

commit_message:
Deploy networking-baremetal when ironic is enabled

The networking-baremetal mechanism driver is often used to connect
baremetal nodes managed by ironic to neutron networks. This ensures
the component can be deployed by the module feature.

revisions:

commit_message:
Do no set ovn-match-northd-version to true by default.

This was introduced in commit ec21edf4d9d548c766dbe4ba9adfb045d0176bf4
when ovn-controllers were not updated before northdb.

Now, ovn-controller are updated first so the "Fail-safe upgrade"
procedure[1] should not be used by default anymore.

Closes-Bug: #2007870

[1] https://docs.ovn.org/en/latest/intro/install/ovn-upgrades.html#fail-safe-upgrade

Change-Id: I38829bc84ecc4cdeabd72e94db8341e86a2c1222

subject: Fix NotImplementedError in dbcounter on SQLA 2.x
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-03-06 20:14:41.000000000', 'files': ['tools/dbcounter/dbcounter.py', 'releasenotes/notes/Fix-dbcounter-NotImplementedError-on-SQLAlchemy-2-21bb6dcdf3ce4225.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix NotImplementedError in dbcounter on SQLA 2.x

This patch fixes a NotImplementedError raised in the dbcounter plugin when using SQLAlchemy 2.x. The plugin signature has changed and now requires an "update_url" method as part of the plugin[1].
This patch also updates the do_incr() explicit SQL string to use a TextClause and the new requirement for named bound parameters[2].

Closes-Bug: #2009521

[1] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/20/changelog/migration_14.html#changes-to-createengineplugin
[2] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/20/changelog/migration_20.html#execute-method-more-strict-execution-options-are-more-prominent

Change-Id: Ie5484597057a3306757cc46b657446ad61ac2098
'}]
commit_message:
Fix NotImplementedError in dbcounter on SQLA 2.x

This patch fixes a NotImplementedError raised in the dbcounter plugin when using SQLAlchemy 2.x. The plugin signature has changed and now requires an "update_url" method as part of the plugin[1].
This patch also updates the do_incr() explicit SQL string to use a TextClause and the new requirement for named bound parameters[2].

Closes-Bug: #2009521

[1] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/20/changelog/migration_14.html#changes-to-createengineplugin
[2] https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/20/changelog/migration_20.html#execute-method-more-strict-execution-options-are-more-prominent

Change-Id: Ie5484597057a3306757cc46b657446ad61ac2098

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2023.1

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2023.1 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie55a55c0aaca57ba4651d632b74e4d2e42a35bd3

commit_message:
Unbind port when offloading a shelved instance

When offloading a shelved instance, the compute needs to remove the
binding so the port will appear as "unbound" in neutron.

Closes-Bug: 1983471

Change-Id: Ia49271b126870c7936c84527a4c39ab96b6c5ea7
Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@ovhcloud.com>

commit_message:
Add NAT rules to the floating IP workflow

The floating IP workflow is now able to manage NAT
rules (portforwarding) if the floating IP is not
associated with any NICs (ports).

This patch is the one of a series of patches
to implement floating ip port forwarding with
port ranges.

The specification is defined in:
https://github.com/openstack/neutron-specs/blob/master/specs/wallaby/port-forwarding-port-ranges.rst

Implements: blueprint https://blueprints.launchpad.net/neutron/+spec/floatingips-portforwarding-ranges
Change-Id: Id715da6591124de45f41cc367bf39a6bfe190c9a

commit_message:
Run handlers before configuring veth interfaces

Handlers from MichaelRigart.interfaces are not run until the end of the
play, which results in the veth role trying to create veth interfaces
against a non-existing bridge.

Change-Id: Ie1c9e1ada50774cbcaec528bd64d8df066c21d2e
(cherry picked from commit fbf000689559c434157d49b147da60725ba9562a)

commit_message:
Validation checks for presence of deprecated services in the role data

This is intended to prevent issues caused by presence of deprecated services during FFU
from 16.2 to 17.1.

Role uses information retrieved from `/usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/roles` to obtain
list of defined services on undercloud.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/862150

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I954e89e9b6980427ef5dbbea380103facd271b58

commit_message:
Stable backports

This patch is the result of "git merge --squash 6e42563" into
stable/bionic, we are doing this since otherwise only the commit at the
top of the stack would produce a functional charm.

List of changes:

6e42563 Sync test-requirements.txt from release-tools
6751832 Migrate percona-cluster to charmcraft build
6ff8acb Use unittest.mock instead of mock
50f3f31 Switch to yoga unit jobs and add py39
393afdd Remove xenial metadata and function tests
e309150 Add yoga bundles and release-tool syncs

Change-Id: I99ee56328d13bd9bb8cfa9a3458f418ff7578466

commit_message:
Improve vip extraction for the multi-cell

The multi-cell stacks don't have networks and only tag
the ports. The code now simply mixes ports of multiple
stacks together. To resolve this we filter for the
tags of stacks in the vip ports.

Co-authored-by: Daniel Bengtsson <dbengt@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Id3eacdb631a7a7102d28ca4b9963fed3d99f2414

subject: set ceph rgw_max_attr_size default to 1024
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-02-27 04:51:19.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/cephadm/ceph-rgw.yaml'], 'message': 'set ceph rgw_max_attr_size default to 1024

Currently rgw_max_attr_size defaults to 256 (a swift default) which
creates problems for openshift on OSP while uploading bigger images.

This patch will update the default value to 1024.

Alternatively, we can enfore a new value to this parameter
using a env file during deployment.

parameters_default:
    CephConfigOverrides:
       rgw_max_attr_size: <new value>

Change-Id: I9b056e60622a9f2755da6312b89d80577ca596f4
Resolves: rhbz#2167161

commit_message:
set ceph rgw_max_attr_size default to 1024

Currently rgw_max_attr_size defaults to 256 (a swift default) which
creates problems for openshift on OSP while uploading bigger images.

This patch will update the default value to 1024.

Alternatively, we can enfore a new value to this parameter
using a env file during deployment.

parameters_default:
    CephConfigOverrides:
       rgw_max_attr_size: <new value>

Change-Id: I9b056e60622a9f2755da6312b89d80577ca596f4
Resolves: rhbz#2167161
(cherry picked from commit 22139d32931bb737837581ca513812b7f82c0f0f)
(cherry picked from commit af7437d2f523f1b04d66505f88993e2b67ae5256)

revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2023-03-08 08:39:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/shelve.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/os-migrate-server/v2.1/migrate-server-with-host.json.tpl', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/os-lock-server/v2.1/lock-server.json.tpl', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/os-migrate-server/v2.30/migrate-server-with-host.json.tpl', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/os-shelve/v2.1/os-shelve.json.tpl', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/os-shelve/v2.1/os-unshelve.json.tpl', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/migrate_server.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/os-shelve/v2.1/os-shelve-offload.json.tpl', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/os-lock-server/v2.1/unlock-server.json.tpl', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/shelve.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/os-migrate-server/migrate-server-with-host.json.tpl', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/os-shelve/v2.1/os-unshelve-rubbish.json.tpl', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/lock_server.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_migrate_server.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_lock_server.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/os-shelve/v2.77/os-unshelve-rubbish.json.tpl', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/os-migrate-server/v2.1/live-migrate-server.json.tpl', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/lock_server.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/os-shelve/v2.91/os-unshelve-rubbish.json.tpl', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_migrate_server.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/migrate_server.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/os-lock-server/v2.1/lock-server-with-reason.json.tpl', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/os-migrate-server/v2.25/migrate-server-with-host.json.tpl', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_shelve.py'], 'message': "Adding a default schema for requests to the 'lock', 'migrate' and 'unshelve' actions.

These three actions have no validation for the body of requests where the microversion
is either below one when conditionals were finally added or where none is indicated at all.
Against these cases, the actions will allow the data to pass, but will do nothing with
it. The request is valid though, so a 202 is returned as if everything was correct.
This can confuse users because there is no sign that they made a mistake on their request.

This change adds a default schema for the three actions that will trigger when no specialized,
one dedicated to a range of microversions, is used instead. These default schemas will only
pass the following two cases:
{ '*action*': null }
{ '*action*': {} }

To avoid breaking compatibility, 'unshelve' also allows for:
{ 'unshelve': { 'availability_zone' : '...' }}

Partial-Bug: #2008341
Change-Id: I3a1ef6d7cb6d74053b65aed84fcee4614ab5dad1
"}]
commit_message:
Adding a default schema for requests to the 'lock', 'migrate' and 'unshelve' actions.

These three actions have no validation for the body of requests where the microversion
is either below one when conditionals were finally added or where none is indicated at all.
Against these cases, the actions will allow the data to pass, but will do nothing with
it. The request is valid though, so a 202 is returned as if everything was correct.
This can confuse users because there is no sign that they made a mistake on their request.

This change adds a default schema for the three actions that will trigger when no specialized,
one dedicated to a range of microversions, is used instead. These default schemas will only
pass the following two cases:
{ '*action*': null }
{ '*action*': {} }

To avoid breaking compatibility, 'unshelve' also allows for:
{ 'unshelve': { 'availability_zone' : '...' }}

Partial-Bug: #2008341
Change-Id: I3a1ef6d7cb6d74053b65aed84fcee4614ab5dad1

commit_message:
Fix issue with ceph-client relation handling

A bug was introduced when changing ceph-client to
an operator framework library that caused the
fallback application_name handling to present
a class name rather than a remote applicaiton name.

This change updates the handling to get at an
`app.name` rather than an `app`.

Closes-Bug: #1995086
Change-Id: I57b685cb78ba5c4930eb0fa73d7ef09d39d73743
func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/1022

commit_message:
Fix issue with ceph-client relation handling

A bug was introduced when changing ceph-client to
an operator framework library that caused the
fallback application_name handling to present
a class name rather than a remote applicaiton name.

This change updates the handling to get at an
`app.name` rather than an `app`.

As a drive-by, this also allow-lists the fully-
qualified rename.sh.

Closes-Bug: #1995086
Change-Id: I57b685cb78ba5c4930eb0fa73d7ef09d39d73743
func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/1022

commit_message:
Rehome functions to enable Neutron's segments integration

Those functions were part of the neutron devstack plugin but we
discussed it during last PTG [1] and decided to move to the Devstack
repo as plugins which are used by e.g. CI jobs which are defined outside
of the neutron repository.
Placement integration is used e.g. in the tempest-slow job which is
defined in tempest and used by many different OpenStack projects.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/neutron-yoga-ptg#L142

Change-Id: I2c26063896ab2679cffd01227a40a3283caa3b17

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-03-08 17:51:08.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/admin/config-ovsfwdriver.rst', 'neutron/agent/linux/openvswitch_firewall/firewall.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/openvswitch_firewall/test_firewall.py'], 'message': '[OVS] Allow custom ethertype traffic in the ingress table

This patch is a partial revert of [1], reinstantiating the code merged
in [2]. This patch is the complementary to [1]: the traffic with
custom ethertypes is allowed in the ingress processing tables, same
as [1] is allowing all traffic from the virtual machine ports in this
host to leave the node. Both, this patch and [1], are bypassing the
OVS firewall just for the traffic with the configured allowed
ethertypes and just for/to the local ports and MAC addresses.

Any other traffic not coming from a local port or with destination
a local port, will be blocked as is now.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/678021
[2]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/668224/

Closes-Bug: #2009221
Related-Bug: #1832758
Change-Id: Ib8340d9430b946a446edf80886c49fbac729073c
'}]
commit_message:
[OVS] Allow custom ethertype traffic in the ingress table

This patch is a partial revert of [1], reinstantiating the code merged
in [2]. This patch is the complementary to [1]: the traffic with
custom ethertypes is allowed in the ingress processing tables, same
as [1] is allowing all traffic from the virtual machine ports in this
host to leave the node. Both, this patch and [1], are bypassing the
OVS firewall just for the traffic with the configured allowed
ethertypes and just for/to the local ports and MAC addresses.

Any other traffic not coming from a local port or with destination
a local port, will be blocked as is now.

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/678021
[2]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/668224/

Closes-Bug: #2009221
Related-Bug: #1832758
Change-Id: Ib8340d9430b946a446edf80886c49fbac729073c

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2023.1

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2023.1 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I462ec85c0f856ef0cb05592b65b1d7bbc7de8a4e

bandwidth value is provided by the method ``get_port_qos``. This method

commit_message:
[OVN] Use the BW values retrieved from ``get_port_qos``

In ``QoSMinimumBandwidthEvent`` and ``QoSBandwidthLimitEvent``, the
bandwidth value is provided by the method ``get_port_qos``. This method
handles when the value to be retrieved is not present in the
required register and returns 0.

Closes-Bug: #2009703
Change-Id: Idbb8f98eaa429601e2f16861eb01ad72c68cffa6

commit_message:
Fix wrong tcp port for heat-cfn endpoint with ssl

The heat-cfn api uses tcp/13005 for its public endpoint when ssl is
enabled. This corrects the wrong port in iptables rule.

Closes-Bug: #2003929
Change-Id: Ibb8037fad70c628ab26a6cf0dd4401bb6b23cc7c
(cherry picked from commit e98f23fd150886a2573dd5eb1f73677d62827433)

subject: [PooledLDAPHandler] Ensure result3() invokes message.clean()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2023-02-24 07:11:51.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_backend_ldap_pool.py', 'keystone/identity/backends/ldap/common.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/fakeldap.py'], 'message': '[PooledLDAPHandler] Ensure result3() invokes message.clean()

result3 does not invoke message.clean() when an exception is thrown
by `message.connection.result3()` call, causing pool connection
associated with the message to be marked active forever. This causes
a denial-of-service on ldappool.

The fix ensures message.clean() is invoked by wrapping the offending
call in try-except-finally and putting the message.clean() in finally
block.

Closes-Bug: #1998789

Change-Id: I59ebf0fa77391d49b2349e918fc55f96318c42a6
Signed-off-by: Mustafa Kemal Gilor <mustafa.gilor@canonical.com>
(cherry picked from commit ff632a81fb09e6d9f3298e494d53eb6df50269cf)
'}]
commit_message:
[PooledLDAPHandler] Ensure result3() invokes message.clean()

result3 does not invoke message.clean() when an exception is thrown
by `message.connection.result3()` call, causing pool connection
associated with the message to be marked active forever. This causes
a denial-of-service on ldappool.

The fix ensures message.clean() is invoked by wrapping the offending
call in try-except-finally and putting the message.clean() in finally
block.

Closes-Bug: #1998789

Change-Id: I59ebf0fa77391d49b2349e918fc55f96318c42a6
Signed-off-by: Mustafa Kemal Gilor <mustafa.gilor@canonical.com>
(cherry picked from commit ff632a81fb09e6d9f3298e494d53eb6df50269cf)

subject: Fix user creation with GRANT in MySQL 8.0(Ubuntu Focal)
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-03-13 10:07:03.000000000', 'files': ['tools/test-setup.sh'], 'message': 'Fix user creation with GRANT in MySQL 8.0(Ubuntu Focal)

In Ubuntu Bionic (18.04) mysql 5.7 version used to create
the user implicitly when using using the GRANT.

Ubuntu Focal (20.04) has mysql 8.0 and with mysql 8.0 there
is no implicit user creation with GRANT. We need to
create the user first before using GRANT command.

This patch updates tools/test-setup.sh so that keystone supports
ubuntu focal.

Story: #2007865
Task: #40190

Change-Id: I86d10729cfc7c02f12df611b56f6e263969dfe4b
Closes-Bug: #1885825
'}]
commit_message:
Fix user creation with GRANT in MySQL 8.0(Ubuntu Focal)

In Ubuntu Bionic (18.04) mysql 5.7 version used to create
the user implicitly when using using the GRANT.

Ubuntu Focal (20.04) has mysql 8.0 and with mysql 8.0 there
is no implicit user creation with GRANT. We need to
create the user first before using GRANT command.

This patch updates tools/test-setup.sh so that keystone supports
ubuntu focal.

Story: #2007865
Task: #40190

Change-Id: I86d10729cfc7c02f12df611b56f6e263969dfe4b
Closes-Bug: #1885825

subject: ldap-backend: replace weakref with backports.weakref for python < 3.4
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-03-13 10:07:03.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'keystone/identity/backends/ldap/common.py'], 'message': 'ldap-backend: replace weakref with backports.weakref for python < 3.4

the ldap module uses weakref.finalize, which is lacking in python 2.7.
this patch adds the backports.weakref module, which contains a backport
of weakref.finalize() function from python 3.6.

Change-Id: I6e6126d403c4bc69ef318dcb57617a602e3faa68

commit_message:
ldap-backend: replace weakref with backports.weakref for python < 3.4

the ldap module uses weakref.finalize, which is lacking in python 2.7.
this patch adds the backports.weakref module, which contains a backport
of weakref.finalize() function from python 3.6.

Signed-off-by: Mustafa Kemal Gilor <mustafa.gilor@canonical.com>
Change-Id: I6e6126d403c4bc69ef318dcb57617a602e3faa68

commit_message:
Add CIP to distributed compute roles

When running DCN, it's necessary to include the DCN role during the
container image prepare step. Else the etcd containers will never be
cached on the undercloud registry. This change adds the
OS::TripleO::Services::ContainerImagePrepare service to each of the
distributed compute roles.

Closes-Bug: #2003811
Change-Id: I6932743cd0674d55075846b1e9d03d0513e7dc65

subject: Fix gitutils to use release-id
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-03-10 17:07:16.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_releases/tests/test_validate.py', 'openstack_releases/gitutils.py'], 'message': "Fix gitutils to use release-id

With the new release identification / naming schema [1] (like:
2023.1 Antelope) new stable branch naming was introduced (like:
stable/2023.1). This was not handled in check_branch_sha method
in validate.py, as the method still searches stable/$series.

This patch fixes this by reading the 'release-id' field from
series_status.yaml if present and uses it as stable/<release-id>
for the branch search.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/release-naming.html

Change-Id: I014b1d6dc561be4db0fc8faa85fb3133e851acfc
"}]
commit_message:
Fix gitutils to use release-id

With the new release identification / naming schema [1] (like:
2023.1 Antelope) new stable branch naming was introduced (like:
stable/2023.1). This was not handled in check_branch_sha method
in validate.py, as the method still searches stable/$series.

This patch fixes this by reading the 'release-id' field from
series_status.yaml if present and uses it as stable/<release-id>
for the branch search.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/release-naming.html

Change-Id: I014b1d6dc561be4db0fc8faa85fb3133e851acfc

commit_message:
Do not recalculate checksum if disk_format is not changed

Even if a glance image is raw, we still recalculate the checksum after
"converting" it to raw. This process may take exceptionally long.

Change-Id: Id93d518b8d2b8064ff901f1a0452abd825e366c0

Co-authored-by: Takashi Kajinami <tkajinam@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Allow unwinding nova DB manage cron jobs

Add enablement flags to classes managing Nova DB records purging and
archieving. With that change, cron jobs can be removed, if no longer
needed. For example, when the cron jobs were originally enabled but
later will be disabled so that users can always restore any deleted
instances.

Co-authored-by: Takashi Kajinami <tkajinam@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I4b2c65b91b83c7ac64f909359585aa76c19d4705

subject: image build: Fix ignored --authfile
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-01-12 07:49:09.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/v2/tripleo_container_image.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'image build: Fix ignored --authfile

This change fixes the ignored --authfile option in `tripleo container
image build`, by ensuring the given value is passed to the underlying
buildah command as the REGISTRY_AUTH_FILE environment.

This re-implements change Ib7beb1341bbbff3c15b191cf34102c3f7e252034
which was reverted later. This change only overrides the specific
environment instead of preserving the all environments.

To merge this change without t-c release, tox.ini is updated so that
the tripleo-common library is installed from git, instead of pypi.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/869796
Resolves: rhbz#2151943
Change-Id: Ifb2bc6ce3f74f1d06378582d8afc362a9dea007c
'}]
commit_message:
image build: Fix ignored --authfile

This change fixes the ignored --authfile option in `tripleo container
image build`, by ensuring the given value is passed to the underlying
buildah command as the REGISTRY_AUTH_FILE environment.

This re-implements change Ib7beb1341bbbff3c15b191cf34102c3f7e252034
which was reverted later. This change only overrides the specific
environment instead of preserving the all environments.

To merge this change without t-c release, tox.ini is updated so that
the tripleo-common library is installed from git, instead of pypi.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/869796
Resolves: rhbz#2151943
Change-Id: Ifb2bc6ce3f74f1d06378582d8afc362a9dea007c

commit_message:
Allow overriding auth file for buildah command

This change introduces the interface to override the auth file used by
the buildah command. This is required to make sure the authfile option
in the image build command is properly honored.

Related: rhbz#2151943
Change-Id: I2c1ce8de6b7d318eb7e72ecec238fa2fea06c9a6

commit_message:
Refactor generation of tripleo_nova_libvirt_guests

When I initially implemented this, I did not consider just injecting
a variable to content would work according to [1].

How ever the method works without any problem and it allows us to
implement a logic in a much simpler way than repeating the similar
(but slightly different) contents.

[1]
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/collections/ansible/builtin/copy_module.html#parameter-content
~~~
For advanced formatting or if content contains a variable, use
the ansible.builtin.template module.
~~~

Change-Id: Iad0bcd02cff54058a7a8eb0f6dd026b4737b7c56

commit_message:
Ensure the script is allowed by tox

Currently pep8 job is failing with the following error when tox 4.0 is
used.

pep8: 354 E failed with ./run-flake8 (resolves to ./run-flake8) is not
allowed, use allowlist_externals to allow it

This adds the external command to the allowlist to fix the error.

Change-Id: I695eab2433e6e50bbe3e9c75ac49513b66a2503c

commit_message:
Ironic: Do not use swift when disabled

A few hardware drivers(redfish and iLO) use swift by default. This
ensures usage of swift is disabled in undercloud because swift is no
longer enabled in undercloud.

commit_message:
Adapt to tox 4.x

skipdist=True does not work with latest tox 4.x.

Also, whitelist_externals was deprecate in favor of the new
allowlist_externals option and is no longer supported by tox 4.x.

commit_message:
Cinder: Fix wrong internal parameter to enable Dell/EMC SC backend

The current implementation enables the dell_sc defined types instead of
the dellemc_sc defined types, but the resource parameters defined in
the template expects the dellemc_sc defined type.

commit_message:
Pin tox < 4.0

tox 4.0 was released but unfortunately it introduced breaking changes,
which affect the tox jobs.

This makes sure tox is not updated when installing dependencies.
The tox package installed by the common ensure-tox role was already
pinned by [1].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/zuul/zuul-jobs/+/866928

Change-Id: Iff5f0227386d4c92c4ad72b4db966851f01f89a1

subject: Ironic: Fail when creating a tempurl key fails
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2022-12-05 10:40:42.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/ironic/ironic-conductor-container-puppet.yaml'], 'message': "Ironic: Fail when creating a tempurl key fails

Currently the script to create a tempurl key does not return proper
return code and any failure in the script is silently ignored. This
can cause incomplete ironic deployment.

This change adds the proper return code to the script so that
the container (and the deployment step) fails if the key can't be
created.

Change-Id: Ib29d75033e0a0fb876aa70136f73b8defb60b6e1
"}]
commit_message:
Ironic: Fail when creating a tempurl key fails

Currently the script to create a tempurl key does not return proper
return code and any failure in the script is silently ignored. This
can cause incomplete ironic deployment.

This change adds the proper return code to the script so that
the container (and the deployment step) fails if the key can't be
created.

Change-Id: Ib29d75033e0a0fb876aa70136f73b8defb60b6e1

commit_message:
Standalone: Drop parameters for old network port resources

We've replaced deprecated deployed-neutron-port.yaml template in
standalone/undercloud deployment, thus we no longer need the old
DeployedServerPortMap.

This also removes the IPPools parameter, which is no longer used now.
The parameter was previously used to define the additional ip on ovs
bridge but was replaced by the VipPortMap parameter.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/862971
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/862974
Change-Id: I540cfdd0a368d409618d3c3e1be30b636de53177

commit_message:
Replace deprecated deployed-neutron-port.yaml

The deployed-neutron-port.yaml file was already deprecated in favor of
the new deployed(_vip)_port.j2 template.

This change also replaces the port_from_pool.j2 template by the same
deployed_vip_port.j2 so that we use the same implementation for all
vip management in overcloud, undercloud and standalone.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/862970
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/862974
Change-Id: Ic374c4d772bcecb0eca35db184cad25bc00ba7e3

subject: Make home directory of qemu user consistent with packages
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2022-11-17 02:52:28.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_nova_libvirt/tasks/install.yml'], 'message': 'Make home directory of qemu user consistent with packages

When the qemu user was created by the libvirt package, its home
directory is set to / . However the current ansible task to create
the user does not set the home directory explicitly which results in
using the /home/qemu directory instead. This fixes the inconsistency
and switches back the home directory to follow what is created by
the libvirt package.

This also fixes the missing system user flag, following how the user
is created by the package.

Note that this change implements the same fix as the dependent change
in tripleo-heat-templates.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/856457
Related-Bug: #1989101
Change-Id: I0cb0a1fb1f24d5f470c9f3fba9d7dd5f77ffd359

commit_message:
Make home directory of qemu user consistent with packages

When the qemu user was created by the libvirt package, its home
directory is set to / . However the current ansible task to create
the user does not set the home directory explicitly which results in
using the /home/qemu directory instead. This fixes the inconsistency
and switches back the home directory to follow what is created by
the libvirt package.

This also fixes the missing system user flag, following how the user
is created by the package.

Note that this change implements the same fix as the dependent change
in tripleo-heat-templates.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/856457
Related-Bug: #1989101
Change-Id: I0cb0a1fb1f24d5f470c9f3fba9d7dd5f77ffd359

commit_message:
Make home directory of qemu user consistent with packages

When the qemu user was created by the libvirt package, its home
directory is set to / . However the current ansible task to create
the user does not set the home directory explicitly which results in
using the /home/qemu directory instead. This fixes the inconsistency
and switches back the home directory to follow what is created by
the libvirt package.

This also fixes the missing system user flag, following how the user
is created by the package.

Closes-Bug: #1989101
Change-Id: If7e761f85b67055f9e26091c9e2cbd8747c541ab

revisions:

commit_message:
overcloud node delete: Fix ignored --overcloud-ssh-port-timeout

The --overcloud-ssh-port-timeout option of the overcloud node delete
command has been unused by any logics actually. This change fixes that
and ensures the option controls ssh timeout during ansible playbook
execution.

Change-Id: I703fc4411008fe83ec62901466a7a2dfaae29daf

subject: Horizon: Remove wrong override of memcached_ipv6
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-13 00:36:39.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/horizon/horizon-container-puppet.yaml'], 'message': 'Horizon: Remove wrong override of memcached_ipv6

The memcached_ipv6 hieradata key is set by the memcached service
resource and is present to all services via global_config_settings.
Thus there is no need to override it in individual template.

In addition, the parameter should be set according to IP version used
for memcached service, not for horizon service, thus the current logic
is wrong.

Change-Id: I6f4442c168f2af7bd87b76b6e3a37313d46ad5c7
'}]
commit_message:
Horizon: Remove wrong override of memcached_ipv6

The memcached_ipv6 hieradata key is set by the memcached service
resource and is present to all services via global_config_settings.
Thus there is no need to override it in individual template.

In addition, the parameter should be set according to IP version used
for memcached service, not for horizon service, thus the current logic
is wrong.

Change-Id: I6f4442c168f2af7bd87b76b6e3a37313d46ad5c7

subject: Test lack of data validation on 'lock', 'migrate' and 'unshelve' endpoints.
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2023-02-28 15:32:43.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/servers/test_servers_negative.py'], 'message': "Test lack of data validation on 'lock', 'migrate' and 'unshelve'
endpoints.

On a request targetted to these endpoints, if the microversion is left
undefined or if it is below the one they are valid from, validation of
the request's body will not trigger and the requests will be answered
with a 202 Accepted message, even though nothing happens from it. This change
adds a series of tempest tests that verify this fact and asserts for the
400 Bad Request message that should come up instead.

Partial-Bug: #2008341
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/875653
Change-Id: I512b6f4e7bd7fe9334b1492c6390d4b4ccdd1feb
"}]
commit_message:
Test lack of data validation on 'lock', 'migrate' and 'unshelve'
endpoints.

On a request targetted to these endpoints, if the microversion is left
undefined or if it is below the one they are valid from, validation of
the request's body will not trigger and the requests will be answered
with a 202 Accepted message, even though nothing happens from it. This change
adds a series of tempest tests that verify this fact and asserts for the
400 Bad Request message that should come up instead.

Partial-Bug: #2008341
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/875653
Change-Id: I512b6f4e7bd7fe9334b1492c6390d4b4ccdd1feb

subject: Disable image volume cache in glance cinder job
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-03-10 06:19:12.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'message': 'Disable image volume cache in glance cinder job

Cinder has a image volume cache feature which, when creating a
bootable volume from image, creates an internal volume which
helps facilitate creating the volume from image faster by
cloning the internal volume.

By default, the image cache feature is disabled in cinder[1]
but devstack enables it in gate jobs[2] to make the execution
of tests faster (that create bootable volume from image).

This is causing issues when we create a volume type in a test
and create a bootable volume from that volume type. The internal
image cache volume also uses the same volume type and while
deleting the volume type during teardown, the operation fails
since the internal volume is still using it.

Currently there is no good way to delete an image cache volume
since it's created with the "cinder" user in the "internal" project.
This needs to be fixed on the cinder side but in the meantime,
we will disable image volume cache feature from
glance-multistore-cinder-import job as it doesn't provide
any additional benefit apart from running a few tests faster.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/9cd834798c3b7d4e9171c1cb16fd83d9d32a4225/cinder/volume/driver.py#L324
[2] https://github.com/openstack/devstack/blob/69d71cfdf9c24d48fbea366714f4595cbd120723/lib/cinder#L178

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/875372
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/874865
Change-Id: I0330bb249d22c4c538a13ad5d2311a2fe5ace9fb
'}]
commit_message:
Disable image volume cache in glance cinder job

Cinder has a image volume cache feature which, when creating a
bootable volume from image, creates an internal volume which
helps facilitate creating the volume from image faster by
cloning the internal volume.

By default, the image cache feature is disabled in cinder[1]
but devstack enables it in gate jobs[2] to make the execution
of tests faster (that create bootable volume from image).

This is causing issues when we create a volume type in a test
and create a bootable volume from that volume type. The internal
image cache volume also uses the same volume type and while
deleting the volume type during teardown, the operation fails
since the internal volume is still using it.

Currently there is no good way to delete an image cache volume
since it's created with the "cinder" user in the "internal" project.
This needs to be fixed on the cinder side but in the meantime,
we will disable image volume cache feature from
glance-multistore-cinder-import job as it doesn't provide
any additional benefit apart from running a few tests faster.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/9cd834798c3b7d4e9171c1cb16fd83d9d32a4225/cinder/volume/driver.py#L324
[2] https://github.com/openstack/devstack/blob/69d71cfdf9c24d48fbea366714f4595cbd120723/lib/cinder#L178

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/875372
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/874865
Change-Id: I0330bb249d22c4c538a13ad5d2311a2fe5ace9fb

commit_message:
Do not dump detail of container definitions

Some containers such as keystone_bootstrap contains secret information
in the container definitions. We should not dump such details into
ansible output.

Closes-Bug: #1998181

(cherry picked from commit 449faf71a514237bbcff959cc81e0cf9310f7816)

subject: Fix access to configs hash symbol in get_auth_endpoint
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-03-10 18:59:33.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/keystone.rb'], 'message': "Fix access to configs hash symbol in get_auth_endpoint

The hash returned by the request method of Puppet::Provider::Openstack
uses symbols instead of strings as keys, see [1].

This prepends the missing ':' in front of the 'auth.auth_url' key to
make it a symbol and to have it return the actual value instead of
always coming back empty.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/src/commit/a1dfd6861f9593f005e72acaef7262e618d2cf6c/lib/puppet/provider/openstack.rb#L123

Closes-Bug: #2010894

Change-Id: I97546a1030559d1f91030a668106e220ce7a7650
"}]
commit_message:
Fix access to configs hash symbol in get_auth_endpoint

The hash returned by the request method of Puppet::Provider::Openstack
uses symbols instead of strings as keys, see [1].

This prepends the missing ':' in front of the 'auth.auth_url' key to
make it a symbol and to have it return the actual value instead of
always coming back empty.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/src/commit/a1dfd6861f9593f005e72acaef7262e618d2cf6c/lib/puppet/provider/openstack.rb#L123

Closes-Bug: #2010894

Change-Id: I97546a1030559d1f91030a668106e220ce7a7650

subject: iscsi: Use assert on checks for readability
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2023-01-09 21:40:42.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/iscsi/tasks/precheck.yml'], 'message': "iscsi: Use assert on checks for readability

assert will also fail when we're not meeting the conditions, makes
clear what we're actually testing, and isn't listed as a skipped task
when the condition is ok.

Change I940b1d3eceb98e16fa366c243672f588b1412d70 dropped CentOS 7,
so now we're just asserting that it's not RedHat.

Change-Id: Iec4e9a6922b67f7c9eb79f580fffbcc8160529e9
"}]
commit_message:
iscsi: Use assert on checks for readability

assert will also fail when we're not meeting the conditions, makes
clear what we're actually testing, and isn't listed as a skipped task
when the condition is ok.

Change I940b1d3eceb98e16fa366c243672f588b1412d70 dropped CentOS 7,
so now we're just asserting that it's not RedHat.

Change-Id: Iec4e9a6922b67f7c9eb79f580fffbcc8160529e9

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2023-03-11 13:45:23.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.d/zuul.yaml', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Update tox.ini to work with tox 4

Tox 4 deprecated whitelist_externals.
Replace whitelist_externals with allowlist_externals
Tox 4 Fail on pass_env/passenv entries containing whitespace.
Updated passenv with comma separated values

Also, we need to temporary turn off coverage job, since it compares
stats of current change with a previous one. It is impossible to collect
stats for previous commit, since it does not include tox fixes.

Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@ovhcloud.com>
Change-Id: I821d846543f1dd55564358550fa074333f8b741b
'}]
commit_message:
Update tox.ini to work with tox 4

Tox 4 deprecated whitelist_externals.
Replace whitelist_externals with allowlist_externals
Tox 4 Fail on pass_env/passenv entries containing whitespace.
Updated passenv with comma separated values

Also, we need to temporary turn off coverage job, since it compares
stats of current change with a previous one. It is impossible to collect
stats for previous commit, since it does not include tox fixes.

Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@ovhcloud.com>
Change-Id: I821d846543f1dd55564358550fa074333f8b741b

commit_message:
Change the release tag to use the release identification

According to the TC resolution [1] and the release identification
document [2], the release number will be used as primary identifier in
the development cycle. Release name will be used in marketing.

[1]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20220524-release-identification-process.html
[2]https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/release-naming.html

Change-Id: Ia3da9bf6d6113edacb0e21de9a51bd60d5e2465b

commit_message:
Migrate instance_name_template to the base class

The [DEFAULT] instance_name_template parameter is used not only by
nova-api but by other services like nova-conductor or nova-compute.
This change migrate the parameter from the api class to the base class
so that users can configure the parameter for all services.

Backport note:
This avoids deprecating the existing parameter in stable branch.

Change-Id: I0f590f12017e743a17d989d3a1008faa9b840e87
(cherry picked from commit 73eb553202e77ca3073764bb863cc07adc7f32c4)

commit_message:
Cyborg NVIDIA GPU Driver support vGPU management

The Cyborg NVIDIA GPU Driver has implemented pGPU management in
the Train release, this patch implements the vGPU management
support in the same driver. For specs about this feature, please
refer to [0].

[0]:https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/cyborg-specs/specs/wallaby/approved/vgpu-driver-proposal.html

Co-Authored-By: Wenping Song <songwenping@inspur.com>

implement blueprint enable-vgpu-in-cyborg

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/2023.1

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/2023.1 branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: If7c27d978281817d022f6ecac276386cc7951fa8

commit_message:
WIP: Add a hacking check for policy names in one module only

This patchset adds a hacking check to Patrole to validate that
policy names are tested in one module only to avoid poor test
organization: a set of policies related to an API or to multiple
APIs should be tested together.

Change-Id: I1da694bd449d88626597dfc533c4dd6699879e85

commit_message:
Make rbac_utils is_admin more robust

This makes is_admin in rbac_utils more robust by doing
a context_is_admin check to determine admin-ness rather than
simply checking whether the RBAC role under test is the
admin role configured in Tempest.

Change-Id: I544b228b3e0896c93c601b509aabce9c78e647ae

subject: Move service validation to rbac_rule_validation
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2018-07-21 20:55:33.000000000', 'files': ['patrole_tempest_plugin/rbac_rule_validation.py', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/unit/test_rbac_rule_validation.py', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/unit/test_policy_authority.py', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/policy_authority.py'], 'message': "Move service validation to rbac_rule_validation

This patchset moves service validation helper function out of
policy_authority module into rbac_rule_validation, because
service validation should be placed in a high-level module
that covers both policy_authority and requirements_authority.

Additionally, the service validation logic is refactored
to use Tempest's get_service_list() under tempest.common.utils
because:

* this approach is configuration driven
* more efficient
* simpler
* uses supported Tempest function

The unit tests are also moved and refactored as appropriate.

Change-Id: I330e1e047e0be73b40d06a3c04caa204ab92d984
"}]
commit_message:
Move service validation to rbac_rule_validation

This patchset moves service validation helper function out of
policy_authority module into rbac_rule_validation, because
service validation should be placed in a high-level module
that covers both policy_authority and requirements_authority.

Additionally, the service validation logic is refactored
to use Tempest's get_service_list() under tempest.common.utils
because:

* this approach is configuration driven
* more efficient
* simpler
* uses supported Tempest function

The unit tests are also moved and refactored as appropriate.

Change-Id: I330e1e047e0be73b40d06a3c04caa204ab92d984

subject: Update policies for some port/router network tests
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2018-07-22 18:54:24.000000000', 'files': ['patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/api/network/test_ports_rbac.py', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/api/network/test_routers_rbac.py', 'releasenotes/notes/new-policy-feature-flags-for-network-tests-b0f6aca0773fd32e.yaml', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/config.py', 'devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'Update policies for some port/router network tests

This patch set updates policies for some port/router network tests
to incorporate those that have recently been added to Neutron's
policy file (because they were missing):

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/577471/5

This includes updating relevant tests with the following policies:

* "create_port:fixed_ips"
* "update_port:fixed_ips"
* "create_router:external_gateway_info"

Also adds a new test for the following policy:

"create_router:external_gateway_info:network_id"

The approach taken is to create new feature flags for the new
policies and apply them to existing tests. This makes it easier
to maintain the tests but does result in the tests getting
skipped for previous releases of OpenStack that don't have
these "newer" policies. However, it is unlikely that policy
will be changed for older releases of OpenStack.

The alternative approach is [1] which leads to a lot of test
maintenance overhead: each combination of the set of all
the policies enforced per test needs to be accounted for
across n, n-1, and n-2, which is quite difficult to maintain.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/584102/5

Change-Id: I679fca4d10a0398cc66755ef428fa7b0bd77195d
'}]
commit_message:
Update policies for some port/router network tests

This patch set updates policies for some port/router network tests
to incorporate those that have recently been added to Neutron's
policy file (because they were missing):

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/577471/5

This includes updating relevant tests with the following policies:

* "create_port:fixed_ips"
* "update_port:fixed_ips"
* "create_router:external_gateway_info"

Also adds a new test for the following policy:

"create_router:external_gateway_info:network_id"

The approach taken is to create new feature flags for the new
policies and apply them to existing tests. This makes it easier
to maintain the tests but does result in the tests getting
skipped for previous releases of OpenStack that don't have
these "newer" policies. However, it is unlikely that policy
will be changed for older releases of OpenStack.

The alternative approach is [1] which leads to a lot of test
maintenance overhead: each combination of the set of all
the policies enforced per test needs to be accounted for
across n, n-1, and n-2, which is quite difficult to maintain.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/584102/5

Change-Id: I679fca4d10a0398cc66755ef428fa7b0bd77195d

subject: Add distinct conf opt groups for both validation methodologies
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2018-08-27 03:21:45.000000000', 'files': ['etc/patrole.conf.sample', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/rbac_rule_validation.py', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/config.py', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/requirements_authority.py', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/unit/test_policy_authority.py', 'releasenotes/notes/distinct-validation-group-opts-f2cbee0f93c797e0.yaml', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/policy_authority.py', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Add distinct conf opt groups for both validation methodologies

This patchset adds a distinct group for each of the validation
methodologies:

  * oslo.policy approach => policy_validation
  * custom requirements approach => requirements_validation

policy_validation receives the following options:

  * custom_policy_files

requirements_validation receives the following options:

  * custom_requirements_file
  * test_custom_requirements

Background: In the initial Patrole spec for project creation submitted
to qa-specs [0] there is much discussion about oslo.policy-driven vs.
requirements-driven approach to RBAC validation. Long story short:
Patrole by default does oslo.policy validation but later added
requirements-driven validation [1]. However, the options for both
ways of doing validation should be made as distinct as possible to
avoid confusion between which options to use for which validation
methods.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/382672/
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/477014/

Change-Id: I2f3205976fb7f690f967cb30570ed9b1bec8293f
'}]
commit_message:
Add distinct conf opt groups for both validation methodologies

This patchset adds a distinct group for each of the validation
methodologies:

  * oslo.policy approach => policy_validation
  * custom requirements approach => requirements_validation

policy_validation receives the following options:

  * custom_policy_files

requirements_validation receives the following options:

  * custom_requirements_file
  * test_custom_requirements

Background: In the initial Patrole spec for project creation submitted
to qa-specs [0] there is much discussion about oslo.policy-driven vs.
requirements-driven approach to RBAC validation. Long story short:
Patrole by default does oslo.policy validation but later added
requirements-driven validation [1]. However, the options for both
ways of doing validation should be made as distinct as possible to
avoid confusion between which options to use for which validation
methods.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/382672/
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/477014/

Change-Id: I2f3205976fb7f690f967cb30570ed9b1bec8293f

commit_message:
Improve unit tests for policy authority module

This patch set improves unit tests for policy authority module:

- adds better/more intuitive resource policy files
- adds tests for validating oslo.policy GenericCheck checks by
  passing in additional metadata

subject: Added in JSON format for test report log, and ability to prevent deleting the log between runs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-11-20 23:26:43.000000000', 'files': ['patrole_tempest_plugin/rbac_rule_validation.py', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/config.py', 'patrole_tempest_plugin/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Added in JSON format for test report log, and ability to prevent
deleting the log between runs

Added Role as a variable to be printed in the report log

Added in 2 new variables:
report_log_format: text (the default) or JSON
  In JSON format, the log will print the test results as a JSON
  object rather than a plaintext string

  Example:
  [Role]: admin, [Service]: nova, [Test]: test_create_agent, [Rules]:
os_compute_api:os-agents, [Expected]: Allowed, [Actual]: Allowed
  vs
  {"role": "admin", "service": "nova", "test": "test_create_agent",
"rules": "os_compute_api:os-agents", "expected": "Allowed", "actual":
"Allowed"}

  In the case where another string is present, the behavior
  defaults to the text-based line display

remove_log_on_run: True (the default) or False
  Controls whether or not to remove the log file on each invocation
  of tempest. This can be useful to preserve when multiple invocations
  are needed, to test multiple roles for example

Change-Id: I7a302e571f4fb5ffb33287c8153be7f8b8e38dc8
'}]
commit_message:
Added in JSON format for test report log, and ability to prevent
deleting the log between runs

Added Role as a variable to be printed in the report log

Added in 2 new variables:
report_log_format: text (the default) or JSON
  In JSON format, the log will print the test results as a JSON
  object rather than a plaintext string

  Example:
  [Role]: admin, [Service]: nova, [Test]: test_create_agent, [Rules]:
os_compute_api:os-agents, [Expected]: Allowed, [Actual]: Allowed
  vs
  {"role": "admin", "service": "nova", "test": "test_create_agent",
"rules": "os_compute_api:os-agents", "expected": "Allowed", "actual":
"Allowed"}

  In the case where another string is present, the behavior
  defaults to the text-based line display

remove_log_on_run: True (the default) or False
  Controls whether or not to remove the log file on each invocation
  of tempest. This can be useful to preserve when multiple invocations
  are needed, to test multiple roles for example

Change-Id: I7a302e571f4fb5ffb33287c8153be7f8b8e38dc8

commit_message:
Enable sphinx.ext.intersphinx for tempest

This package is used for automatic generation of links
to the documentation of objects in other projects.

Adding a mapping for the Tempest  makes it possible to
convert a reference like :py:class:`tempest.test.BaseTestCase`
to the link:
https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/library/code/tempest.test.html#tempest.test.BaseTestCase

Depends-On: I9a843ea024e71fbb377de5aa57cedafdd456269d

Change-Id: I946e78d4360a273e7fac23ac2cf879acb613da66

revisions:

Loading roles from config in one place. Fixing the issue with loading
roles from rbac_test_role and rbac_test_roles options.
Checking for admin role moved into RbacUtilsMixin class. In a stage when
the _init_roles is called It verifies the admin role ID for all roles,
including implied roles.
Added an ability to restore original roles if used pre-provisioned
credentials.
Modifying the PolicyAutority for taking a test_object to use is_admin
function in the _is_admin_context function.

TODO:
* unit tests
* functional test for pre-provisioned credentials ??? if i will figure
  out how to do this.

Change-Id: I4add0d24548163254f0e3051b38391dfe9948c28
'}]
commit_message:
Role usage refactoring

Loading roles from config in one place. Fixing the issue with loading
roles from rbac_test_role and rbac_test_roles options.
Checking for admin role moved into RbacUtilsMixin class. In a stage when
the _init_roles is called It verifies the admin role ID for all roles,
including implied roles.
Added an ability to restore original roles if used pre-provisioned
credentials.
Modifying the PolicyAutority for taking a test_object to use is_admin
function in the _is_admin_context function.

TODO:
* unit tests
* functional test for pre-provisioned credentials ??? if i will figure
  out how to do this.

Change-Id: I4add0d24548163254f0e3051b38391dfe9948c28

commit_message:
Support both rbac_test_role and rbac_test_roles
in tempest.conf.
Resolved, user is assigned admin role irrespective of what value is given
to rbac_test_role in tempest.conf

commit_message:
Allow testing of neutron plugins

Added a subclass of policy_authority to allow Neutron extensions to
be tested with Patrole, with the expectation that these tests would
live in the Neutron plugins, as in tempest plugins for the
Neutron extensions.

Depends-on: I498c637da9dac7605851b2edbbfb302103c3d6a9

Change-Id: I13e1b4223cff5efe008cb7207304a51d04e7a6ec

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2019-09-04 18:52:19.000000000', 'files': ['patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/api/network/rbac_base.py'], 'message': 'Fix 'use_dynamic_credentials = false' with Neutron extension tests

When running Neutron extension tests and Tempest configured with
'use_dynamic_credentials = false' the user_id and tenant_id are unset
and results in the tests not being executed: "Could not find user: None."

Both user_id and tenant_id are needed in rbac_utils [0].

[0] https://github.com/openstack/patrole/blob/master/patrole_tempest_plugin/rbac_utils.py#L163

Change-Id: I88d0624bc279b004ebe5f721cdef5adf12bd0ed9
'}]
commit_message:
Fix 'use_dynamic_credentials = false' with Neutron extension tests

When running Neutron extension tests and Tempest configured with
'use_dynamic_credentials = false' the user_id and tenant_id are unset
and results in the tests not being executed: "Could not find user: None."

Both user_id and tenant_id are needed in rbac_utils [0].

[0] https://github.com/openstack/patrole/blob/master/patrole_tempest_plugin/rbac_utils.py#L163

Change-Id: I88d0624bc279b004ebe5f721cdef5adf12bd0ed9

commit_message:
Fix resource leak from 'test_create_image_from_volume_backed_server'

'test_create_image_from_volume_backed_server' causes two volumes and one
volume snapshot to be leaked:
 - leak from the attached volume
 - leak from a volume that is created using the image in the tempest.conf
 - leak from a volume snapshot that is created from the attached volume

Change-Id: I2c1a1db8215bd054818ec447afdc02815e9994a4

commit_message:
Retrying create_test_server

Zuul jobs fails very often with errors at creating an object,
presumably this can be resolved by retry a call.

Add `retry` function to RbaccUtils class.
Add `retry` config option.
Override the `create_test_server` function to use `retry`.

Change-Id: Ifad316364eaa9ad0d2885a9fbc7a81024d1b13c8
Story: 2004369
Task: 27972
